body_html: torch.cuda.FloatTensor and torch.FloatTensor share the same TensorBase base class that defines is_cuda interface. is_cuda is always True for the former and always False for the latter. It is useful when you want to know a tensor is on gpu or not.
body_text: torch.cuda.FloatTensor and torch.FloatTensor share the same TensorBase base class that defines is_cuda interface. is_cuda is always True for the former and always False for the latter. It is useful when you want to know a tensor is on gpu or not.
body: `torch.cuda.FloatTensor` and `torch.FloatTensor` share the same TensorBase base class that defines `is_cuda` interface. `is_cuda` is always `True` for the former and always `False` for the latter. It is useful when you want to know a tensor is on gpu or not.
